question: Want one? SCHNACK, the owner, carries a six pack of Schlitz.
answer: I'll take two. Schnack hands them over. Monix might speak, but he drinks instead.

question: So, Monix. The trade went through.
answer: Really?

question: You know, you're not exactly a spring chicken anymore...
answer: Just tell me.

question: That score board. ANGLE ON It's a Magnovox.
answer: You still owe me $400.

question: Yeah, so? Who the Hell areyou,the barbecue police? Tell youwhat,I've got the note pad, so I'llaskthe questions 'Cause I changed my name, that's why. You like it? It ain't fine. It's fine... DOWNTOWN!
answer: IT'S SEVEN FORTY-FIVE, YOU BETTER

question: Shit. It's been a pleasure serving you. Clarence tosses his note pad on the table and his Mother tosses him his duffle bag.
answer: And don't think I didn't see those cotton briefs of yours in there.

question: Stay outta my stuff!
answer: Don't you know our ancestors had to pick that cotton? Get yourself some silk underpants. Have some respect.

question: Ladies and gentleman, please rise... .For the National Anthem... Of your Flint Michigan Tropics. SO TELL ME FLINT, ARE WE HOT NOW, HERE'S THE STARTING LINE UP I'm living a dream, Flint and I know you are too. AT GUARD, from Peoria Illinois, six foot one -- this guy's single and he can cook lasagna, I've seen him do it -- TWIGGY -- MUNSONNNNNNN! Bobby Dee hits the disco ball as TWIGGY trots out. FROM SOUTH BEND INDIANA, the man with a heart of gold, his brother's a retard, six foot one, he drives down to visit all the time, at forward, he reads to him, BEE BEE YOUR MAN IN THE MIDDLE. Seven foot two, from the People's Republic of Uzbechistan, he's tall, he's sensitive -- loves candle light and long walks on the beach -- VAKIDIS Now this next guy, where do I start? First of all, that wife of his, she is... Wow. CANONS, people. If you know what I'm saying. I don't think she's here tonight, but if she was you'd see what I'm talking about. AND FINALLY Alright you guys, let's huddle up! Vakidis! Where's he walking to? Kong, get Vakidis. A very short Asian man, KONG, nods. The uniform hangs on his tiny body. Let's put on a good show tonight, okay? Let's keep it in the air, keep shooting, look for the baseball pass, launch some early threes to set the tone. Bee Bee, try and do that no-look behind your back thing, I love that, okay? Now let's bring it in. One two three-- Hey, you lose weight, Father Pat?
answer: Oh, fuck off. What's with the cone tonight Jackie? Jackie points up to a leak in the ceiling.

question: For safety. Just then, Vakidis jogs over, SLIPPING HORRIBLY in the puddle, ripping his groin. Enough with the cheese already. More chips, less cheese, how many times do I have to tell you? WHISTLE! Jackie's been walking with the ball. FATHER PAT THE REF wears a holy collar with pin strips over it. Traveling!?... On who?
answer: On you.

question: That's bullshit, Father Pat! Jackie, furious, SLAMS THE BALL down on the floor. Yes! Nice first half guys! That's what I call Flint Tropic's basketball! Let's stay focused on the four
answer: Yo, Jackie, is the washing machine broken? ANGLE ON

question: Listen up guys And Bobby Dee, I need you to clean out your desk. You're not fired. I sold your desk. And I'm going to shed a few lockers, so everyone's getting a locker buddy.
answer: Forget that. I need my own locker... For the panty dropper. Clarence reveals his 'panty dropper' a brown full-length leather coat.

question: Fine. Now, there's one last thing
answer: Firepower? Who'd you hire?

question: At guard, six one, the hometown kid, from your very own Flint Michigan -- He punches in bunches Ed MONIXXXXXXXX! We hear a TOILET FLUSH. Monix exits the bathroom stall buttoning his pants.
answer: You're out of toilet paper. Monix doesn't receive a warm welcome. It's more of a stare- off.

question: Okay, now, I know everyone in this room has probably been punched in the face by Monix at one time or another. One of you may have even had your collar bone broken, twice. But that's in the past now and- Thanks Bobby. I love half time. Anyways, welcome aboard.
answer: So. Who wants to be my locker buddy?

question: Ladies and Gentleman, this man is about to attempt the impossible. The $10,000 full court shot. So, tell me, what's your name?
answer: Dukes.

question: Okay, Dukes. You feeling it?
answer: Yeah dude.

question: What are you going to spend all of your money on if you win? A shirt?
answer: Yeah man, a shirt. Ha! Whoooo!

question: Okay people, Dukes is excited. Let's get some clapping going as he prepares himself for the impossible. This is drama, folks! C'mon now, let's hear it! The $10,000 shot people, let's hear it!!! For the first time, Dukes looks kind of serious. He sizes up the distant hoop... He looks ready... And... Here he goes! An uncoordinated baseball pass... Sailing off into the distance... And... Shit.
answer: YES!!! HOLY SHIT DUDE!!! I'M A

question: Did he step on the line?
answer: No, it was legal. He made it.

question: Who the Hell has $10,000? I sure he stepped on the line, you know what I'm saying?
answer: Listen to this crowd. You can't screw a kid over like that. People will kill you. He's right. The crowd is too hyped for Jackie to explain that he's broke.

question: Hey honey, guess who got traded to Flint?
answer: I don't know, who?

question: Monix. The word Monix stops her in her tracks.
answer: Monix?

question: Yeah! He's already got an NBA ring, but he's still playing... In Flint. Can you believe it?
answer: No, I can't. Lynn closes her book, fidgety...

question: Get the funk outta-of-my-face... A SIGN SAYS Not much. Oh yeah. Just icing them down. Well look at you! You look beautiful. What's different? No, that's not it... Did your tits get bigger? Don't lie to me. Those things got bigger. Well, good job. Jackie keeps walking, bumping into MS. QUINCY, Clarence's mother.
answer: Yo Jackie. You know, that wife of yours has been making out with that Mark Spitz lookin' motherfucker all night. She gestures to a guy who's lip-locked with Jackie's wife. LUCY MOON unbuttons her fur coat.

question: Oh. It's okay, Lucy and I've got an open relationship.
answer: I know that. But he's about to suck on her Damn tits, right here in front of all these people.

question: She's hot right? What can I say, we're freedom lovers. Hey honey! Lucy Moon ignores him, only making out harder. Right on! I'm not jealous. It's a sweet deal for both of us.
answer: Have you ever slept with another woman?

question: I could. That's the beauty of it. No ball and chain here.
answer: Have you ever been to an orgy?

question: Can we talk?
answer: --Yo, Monix, you're wasted! Ha! Kyle has come out to say hi.

question: Yeah. Sorry man--
answer: What's up! That of jump shot of yours ain't broke yet, is it?

question: No. Ha.
answer: Great back door cut for the lay-up in the third. That's how basketball should be played.

question: Kyle, can you give us a second? We need to talk.
answer: No problem. Great game tonight man.

question: Why does your boyfriend like me so much?
answer: You're his favorite player.

question: Look, there are still some things I think we need to talk about.
answer: I've already said everything I'm ever going to say to you.

question: I see. You're really not going to stop me?
answer: No. Monix walks more, until Lynn speaks. You're going to end up walking with a cane the rest of your life. You have to quit.

question: And do what?
answer: I don't know... Kill yourself, I guess.

question: Kill myself?
answer: You act like there's nothing else in the world besides basketball. If that's how you really feel, then go ahead and get it over with. I'm going to sleep.

question: Thanks for the pep. talk.
answer: No problem.

question: Lynn. Can I ask you for one favor?
answer: You want a favor?

question: My knee.
answer: Oh, Jesus Christ Monix. It's 4 a.m. Lynn stares at him in disbelief. Monix shrugs.

question: No one here can drain it right.
answer: Fine. Monix nods, then makes a move toward the door. No. You're not coming in. We'll do it in the yard.

question: (into the rear view, very Your Mom would be proud of you today.
answer: .I'm sure each of you have heard the rumors. And I'm here to tell you, the rumors are true. The ABA will be merging with the NBA at the end of this season.

question: YES!!!
answer: Our league is sold. And the NBA agreed to all of our financial demands! Now Jackie turns inward, more quietly intense. This is, without question, the greatest moment of his life.

question: You're a real owner. You're in the
answer: Four of our teams will be absorbed into the NBA family, the rest of you will terminate operations.

question: Exactly! You know it! I'm sorry, wait, what?
answer: The Nuggets, The Nets, The Spurs and the Pacers will play in the NBA next year. The rest of us will dissolve.

question: Dissolve? Dissolve, like, how? How do I dissolve into the NBA? The winning owners look at each other, not sure how to handle Jackie. What's happening?
answer: I'm sorry Jackie. We all know how. emotional you get. We waited until the very last second to tell you. Jackie pounds the table.

question: No. NO! NO!!! He kicks over his chair... I don't want a sum! I want my team! C'mon you guys, you're not going to just sit here and take the money, are you? They are. What do the Spurs have that we don't? Oh, c'mon, that's BULLSHIT!
answer: The NBA is taking four teams, Jackie, there's nothing I can do. Jackie goes quiet, thinking... An epic idea hits him.

question: The best four teams should go.
answer: What?

question: Forget the huge fan base, the stadiums, the economic... Growing... package... inventions... I KNOW WHAT I SAID! The four teams with the best records should merge.
answer: These four teams DO have the best records. Flint's only won six games all year!

question: So far. The season isn't over.
answer: This plan sounds like a lot of fun, but it's too late. The commissioner, me, has already decided.

question: YES. That's right. What he said. C'mon you guys, let's try to stay psyched. This is a chance to become a real NBA franchise!
answer: There's no way we can make it to fourth place. It's mathematically impossible.

question: I ran the numbers. All we have to do is win about eighty-two percent of our remaining games.
answer: Eighty-two percent? Isn't that a lot?

question: I tried Jackie. They won't take it. They said it's 'symbolic.'
answer: What does symbolic mean?

question: I don't know. But they said I need a real check.
answer: I don't know what your bank is talking about. That is a real check. I signed it myself.

question: It's written in glitter, dude. Can't you just give me, like, a regular sized one?
answer: I don't get it. People are usually able to cash these. Maybe you should try another bank. If you run into any more trouble, let me know.

question: Okay Jackie, thanks man.
answer: Any time, congratulations. Jackie turns away from Dukes and exhales, walking back to the bus.

question: OH, C'MON!? Where's the charge, Father Pat?
answer: Both feet weren't planted.

question: OH, SUCK MY COCK. I WILL MURDER
answer: That's it, you're out.

question: Quit talking and play defense! The sweaty guy backs in on Clarence, posting up top.
answer: Right on! I'm open baby! Try a behind-the-back! Monix delivers a nice two handed bounce pass, but Clarence isn't ready for anything fundamentally sound -- The ball hits him in the nuts. Ah, shit. I brought us some ice. Monix is startled. Clarence, his roommate for the night, enters.

question: Ice? What for?
answer: I don't know, it's free. Clarence takes some ice, pops it in his mouth and starts crunching. Want some?

question: You turned off the Celtics?
answer: I don't watch people play basketball. They watch me. With that, Clarence pulls out a JOINT and lights it.

question: What the Hell is that?
answer: It's a fucking Egg-McMuffin. Monix opens the window, clearing the pot smoke out of his face. JACKIE EXITS the bathroom, having just taken a shower. He's wearing a very small robe. This is now the fourth player who's sleeping in this tiny room.

question: Why don't you shower in your room?
answer: My wife is using it. I'll be crashing with you guys tonight.

question: Jackie, have you ever even slept with your wife? Sounds like a great arrangement.
answer: You guys need to wake up. Quit living like it's the 1950's, man. Live it up. Hey Clarence, let's have some of that smoke, bro.

question: I'm pretty sure we have a game tomorrow.
answer: This stuff won't affect you. It's premium. Jackie finishes inhaling, then holds it out for Monix. He stares at the joint, then around the room at his teammates.

question: Well, if this is really going to be my life, I might as well be stoned like everyone else.
answer: Well said. Monix takes the stupid joint. The instant Monix inhales he

question: What the Hell is this?
answer: What do you mean?

question: It's harsh.
answer: Take that back.

question: Yeah, in the yard.
answer: Your Mom grew this?

question: It's sweet grass.
answer: Well, I'm finished, thanks.

question: What's wrong, my Mom's weed ain't good enough for you?
answer: I guess not.

question: Alright, break it up. Everyone huddle up!... VAKIDIS! OVER HERE. Where is he walking to?
answer: Oh, that's a bunch of dog shit.

question: Hey! You guys want to merge or not? Because the fastest way to screw this up is to start punching people in the face while the commissioner is at home, watching the game with his kids... Children are very impressionable. Their minds are not yet soiled by the cruel realities of this world.
answer: What?

question: MONIX! NO!
answer: What about commercials?

question: What?
answer: Commercials, what about commercials? Jackie thinks about this, then nods 'good idea.'

question: I like it. Time out Ref! SOMEBODY HIT SOMEBODY! Okay, solid first half guys, but we're going to have to make some
answer: --This is bullshit guys. They're kicking our ass in basketball and they're kicking our ass during the commercials, too. Does anybody here understand the concept of the pick and roll? Because they're going to keep double teaming at the top of the key until somebody rotates the Damn ball...

question: Yeah! C'mon guys! Rotate the ball. Monix looks at this group and gets even madder.
answer: Does anyone in this room have any pride? Don't you realize, this is thelast four weeks of basketball anyus are ever going to play?Is thishow we're really going togo out?You'd think we'd want toend ourcareers battling, hustling after every loose ball. Boxing out under the boards. Setting picks for our teammates. But we haven't done shit out there. Twiggy Munson and Scootsie Double-Day hang their heads. We're a bunch of selfish assholes -- And I've got news for you, we aren't going to finish in fourth, we're going to finish dead last. Monix paces in front of the guys, a man possessed. One day, you're going to look back on your life... And you're going to look back on this time... And you're going to realize... Monix is staring right at Clarence. And Clarence is actually listening... .You're going to realize you never even played basketball. A moment of silence after the intensity. Monix waddles to the door. Now, you guys have fun out there in the second half. If anyone needs me, I'll be in the training room, draining my knee. Monix limps off, everyone's head is hanging low.

question: What kind of huge idea?
answer: Two more Johnny Walkers. And another pack of Kools. Well, tell her that's just fine with me.

question: Monix. REVEAL
answer: Well, well, well, look who it is. Brian, I'd like you to meet Jumping Johnny Downtown Funky stuff Boner- time finger-blast Fag-erton.

question: Johnny for short. Two coffees.
answer: So, what brings you to the The Kremlin?

question: Listen, I know you and I haven't always been the best of buddies.
answer: I hate to break it to you, Clarence, but the Tropics will never play in the NBA.

question: So maybe we won't. But like you said, I don't want to look back on this with any regrets. I know what you think of me. But I'm willing to put our differences aside. I'm telling you right now, I'll do whatever it takes to win.
answer: You mean, like, pass?

question: I would consider passing, yes.
answer: Sorry kid. Even if I wanted to play harder, this knee won't let me.

question: I'm not just talking about you playing point guard... I'm talking about you teaching us... Monix could not be less interested. Monix, you know more about basketball than any man who's ever set foot in Flint. Monix drinks, not into it... All I'm saying is, instead of getting so pissed off at us all the time, why not just show us what the Hell you're talking about? Coach us a little. I mean, we can't get any worse.
answer: And why should I give a shit about the Tropics?

question: I know you. You've got all that basketball shit stored up in your head. I know you're dying to pass it down to somebody. Why not us?
answer: What about Jackie? He's the coach.

question: Looking good Monix.
answer: Thanks. You too.

question: Ms. Quincy told me the Tropics asked you to coach them.
answer: I know what it takes to be a real team, Lynn.

question: Stay still.
answer: It doesn't matter. The truth is, I hate basketball right now.

question: Do you really hate basketball? Or do you hate yourself?
answer: Why would I hate myself?

question: Well, for one, you cheated on me.
answer: You hate me for that. Not me. Lynn just stares at him. Okay, maybe I hate myself a little.

question: You don't wear the ring around your neck anymore. Where is it?
answer: I rode the bench through the playoffs, Lynn.

question: Monix, that was greatest moment of your career. And you look back on it like some kind of embarrassment.
answer: Riding the bench was the greatest moment of my career?

question: You did more than ride the bench, Monix.
answer: What else did I do?

question: Every practice, you took your team to the limit. I know you did. I was the one draining this stupid knee of yours every night. The Celtics were practicing against you, Monix. And when you ran that scout team, you were running Milwaukee's offense better than their first stringers ever could. Lynn continues the business of disposing fluid into the toilet and preparing another syringe. By game time, your team knew where Milwaukee was going to be before their own players did. The Celtics made the right adjustments to win that series. And those adjustments came from you.
answer: So, I should be proud of running the scout team?

question: Dave Cowens put that ring in the palm of your hand. And he told you to wear it with pride, because you were a champion. And he meant it too.
answer: He was being a nice guy. The bench is the bench.

question: Your whole life, you've bitched about people playing selfish. It takes a team to win, right?
answer: That's right.

question: But when you're on the team, your effort doesn't count? Is that it?
answer: Watch that needle.

question: Answer me. Would they have won?
answer: I don't know.

question: Yes you do. You know. Monix looks away for a moment.
answer: Why are you doing this? What does any of this matter, anyway?

question: Nice leg kick Kong. Those flexible hips are a coach's dream.
answer: Are we going to practice or what?

question: This is practice, okay Clarence? We need to get two thousand people in here! Our intro dance has to blow people's minds. He begins pacing around, more passionate than ever... From now on, I want our afros bigger... And shinier ... . I want our shorts shorter... And tighter... We're going to pull our tube socks up higher than we ever have before. The team seems to be looking off screen. What's wrong? Hey, you're back! Listen, you should probably chalk your hands up for this number.
answer: Jackie, I asked Monix to coach us.

question: Coach? Jackie is totally thrown by this. He looks around at the team. Clearly, a decision has been made. What do you mean, coach? What is this? What's going on? It's a Mutiny.
answer: Jackie. Don't be like that.

question: Hold on a second. Last time I checked, we didn't live in Flint, Russia. We live in Flint, America. I'm coach until a new one is elected.
answer: Don't make us elect Monix, man. Alright, show of hands. Who wants Monix to step in as player-coach? Everyone feels bad, but they all raise their hands.

question: It's cool. I get it. I'm a big boy, I can handle it.
answer: Don't take it so hard, Jackie. You're a great owner. We all know that.

question: Woah. Hold on. Did you just say 'great owner?'
answer: Yeah. Everyone thinks so.

question: Now, when you said great owner, were you just saying that? Because it's not cool to mess with me about this.
answer: We mean it. For real. Monix is just more of an X's and O's kind of guy, that's all. Jackie is emotional. It's a bittersweet moment. He takes off his whistle, then walks over and hands Monix his whistle.

question: Here. You may need this. Now he pulls out a bunch of crazy notes on loose paper written in ball point pen. The pages look insane. And here are some ideas for plays I've jotted down. Just thoughts.
answer: Thanks Jackie. The way I see it, any team in this league can put together a run. Most of our opponents are all flash. If we play unselfish, fundamental basketball, we can win games.

question: I like it. Unselfish, guys.
answer: Yes. Unselfish. Unselfish meaning tough team defense, full and half court traps, boxing your man out to help the team rebound.

question: Would everyone let the man talk please? Clarence is serious. This shuts everyone up.
answer: The most important work we do on the court is away from the basketball. Monix FLIPS OPEN A SWITCH BLADE KNIFE AND STABS THE BALL, deflating it. This gets everyone's attention. Until you start moving like a real team, you practice without a ball. Alright, Clarence, run the offense.

question: I don't get it.
answer: Set a pick for somebody. Clarence jogs over and stands next a scout team opponent. Okay, that's kind of a pick, I guess. Try standing on the other side of Scootsie's man, so you free him up to cut into the lane. Monix corrects Clarence, moving his body the way he wants him to stand. Widen your stance. Plant your feet. Hands back. Like this. Now Scootsie GO. Set a pick for Jackie. Scootsie cuts across the lane. The team slowly gets i rotating faster. Now Jackie pick Bee Bee's man, and rotate to the rim like this... Everyone move to the open space. And Clarence you swing back out up top. They've completed the play. Monix stands there, smiling. The players look at each other, what's the big deal? You know what that was?

question: What.
answer: A flash to the high side post with an outside screen and a back door cut. Let's do it again.

question: Monix, can I talk to you for .a second?
answer: No. No talking.

question: Wait...
answer: GO! Jackie hangs his head, but then accepts his fate. He runs. We need to get in shape fellas. And we need to learn some fundamentals quick. -- AGAIN! They run it again, getting more and more winded. I want you to be brain dead. Because someday you're going to be too tired, or too nervous to think - - AGAIN! And when you are, this is the play I'm going to call. The play that your lungs and legs will have memorized. We will be able to run this in our sleep. Clarence tries to gag himself with his fingers. HEY! No sticking your fingers down your throat, Clarence, I saw that. You're going to puke. And it's going to be all natural -- AGAIN! MOVE MOVE MOVE! FOURTH QUARTER NOW!

question: You're fired!
answer: Fuck you.

question: Fuck you.
answer: Get up and run. You're going to puke like everybody else.

question: Monix, I need to talk to you.
answer: We'll. talk after you puke. GO!

question: I can't puke Monix!
answer: Yes you can. Go. Jackie crawls harder along the hardwood.

question: Monix! You don't understand. I've never thrown up in my life.
answer: What are you talking about?

question: I've never puked. Ever.
answer: That makes no sense. Everyone has thrown up before.

question: I haven't. I swear to God. I can eat anything. I can drink anything. I've been sick, but I've never puked. I swear to God.
answer: That's bullshit. Keep moving, you're going to puke.

question: I don't puke. I can't do it! It's the truth! I swear on my Mother's grave. At this point, Monix can't help but be intrigued.
answer: What about when you were a baby? Babies throw up all the time.

question: My Mom said I never did. I swear. She said I was fascinating.
answer: No way.

question: You can call my Dad! I've never puked. When Jackie looks up at Monix, it's clear he is not lying.
answer: Isn't that kind of dangerous?

question: What do you mean?
answer: What happens if you swallow poison?

question: I don't know. I ate bad sausage before. But nothing happened.
answer: Stand up. Jackie manages to stand up. Have you ever been punched in the Jejunum?

question: I don't know. What's a Jejunum?
answer: It's part of your small intestine.

question: I don't know. I doubt-- Mom?
answer: You okay? Jackie is about to speak, but then takes stock of his feelings. There is now an air of tranquility about him. Reborn. He's almost Euphoric...

question: I'm beautiful.
answer: .On offense, we share the ball. We look for the easy pass, not the spectacular pass... Jackie rolls off the pick and looks for it. For the first time in this sequence, we see the ball. Clarence has a clear passing lane -- He feeds Jackie for a lay up. . If a guy's more open than you are, he gets the ball... Instead of celebrating, Clarence hustles back on Defense. The Tropics execute a half court trap. As we watch Monix play, we continue to the voice over from practice... Listen up. I'll in-bound. Clarence, protect the ball and penetrate if you can. Kick it out to Scootsie or me and everyone crash the boards hard. Looking good, we're thirty seconds away from taking this one home. Let's bring it in.

question: VAKIDIS! NO!!! Shit. I asked you up to the Daiquiri room, because this is a private matter. As you know, I threw up recently. In this bag, is ten thousand dollars.
answer: No way. Really?

question: Actually, it's twenty three hundred. But I'm going to pay you the rest. The Tropics will not let you down. From now on, I want my conscience clear.
answer: Wow. Thanks Jackie.

question: Which girls? Oh. It doesn't look like it. Wow. It's true, the ball girls are flashing the crowd with every kick. I didn't do it. They did. Melinda winks at Jackie, as her skirt flips up. The crowd is going goes crazy. -ATTENDANCE
answer: Clarence, do me a favor, if you dunk the ball, don't dance afterwords. Act like you've been there before.

question: Actually, Monix, I need him to dance. A lot. The fans need it.
answer: Fine, you can dance a little bit.

question: If you dunk it, go fuckin' ape shit. -GAME TIME. CLARENCE DUNKS THE BALL Just keep taping it up. I'm fine. Now the COMMISH steps over.
answer: Hey Jackie.

question: Oh, hey Commish.
answer: Listen, my office has been getting your numbers. You claim you've had over two thousand people at every home game this month.

question: That's correct. The commissioner looks around, skeptical. As we scan the stands, it's clear the crowd is still not big enough.
answer: Well, we've counted only nine hundred and eighty three here tonight.

question: What, you don't think people go to the bathroom? Saturdays can be a little slow. You should have been here the other night, it was SO PACKED.
answer: Don't bullshit me, Jackie. The commish waves over a little bald man in a suit. PEEKSKILL carries a brief case and never talks. From now on, Peekskill here will be attending every Tropics home game. You're going to have to get a real crowd here if you want to qualify for the merger.

question: Well, if it isn't the toast of Flint Michigan. Shouldn't you be out signing autographs? Monix doesn't speak... He stares into her eyes for a moment.
answer: Will you marry me?

question: What?
answer: You heard me.

question: Technically, we're still married right now, Monix.
answer: You know what I mean.

question: Do I?
answer: Do you love me?

question: Probably.
answer: Then let's do it. For real this time. I need you.

question: YEAH. HA! And I suppose you need him?
answer: He's loyal.

question: Dogs are loyal.
answer: He ain't stupid, if that's what you're trying to say.

question: NO PROBLEM, I'LL LEAVE RIGHT NOW. Monix and Lynn meet eyes. Lynn tries not to smile, trying to be mad. Kyle pulls on some jeans and gets into his truck.
answer: Don't fuck with him. It's just rude. What do you think you're doing?

question: What's up. I forgot my stupid walle- -Kyle stops in his tracks. He HEARS a sound he's never truly heard before, Lynn having an orgasm. He slowly walks toward the bedroom. KYLE'S POV Monix?
answer: Stop that.

question: Stop what?
answer: Ixne-on-the-erking off-je. Monix finally notices his sex partner is having a conversation. He turns to see Kyle.

question: We sold out, man. You did good.
answer: I'm scared of bears, Clarence.

question: What?
answer: I hate these things. I'm freaking out right now.

question: If you're scared of bears, why the Hell are you wrestling one then?
answer: Look at this place. We're packed. It was a good idea.

question: Well, don't worry, you'll pin him easy. It'll be fine.
